byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Donald J Trump says in town-hall-style-forum on MSNBC that women who receive abortions should be subjected to some kind of punishment if procedure is made illegal, sparking criticism from pro-life groups, who have only called for those performing abortions to be punished; Trump recants statement hours later, but many Republicans remain concerned remarks like those could cost party general election.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump, pressed on his support for an abortion ban, envisioned “some form of punishment” for women having the procedure. Hours later, he revised himself.

headline.main: Donald Trump, Abortion Foe, Eyes ‘Punishment’ for Women, Then Recants
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Call on Abortions Rattles G.O.P.

snippet: Mr. Trump, pressed on his support for an abortion ban, envisioned “some form of punishment” for women having the procedure. Hours later, he revised himself.
